item.title: Horticulture Specialist
item.description:
Horticulture Specialist

Growing is our business and our business is growing. The Irwin family has owned and operated commercial greenhouses since the 1960’s. The mission of the family’s patriarch, Jim Irwin, was to consistently produce high quality horticultural products in a controlled greenhouse environment. This mission continues today as the next two generations continue to grow the business.

item.title: Marijuana Compounds Show Promise In Protecting Brain Cells From Alzheimer's
item.description:
Marijuana Compounds Show Promise In Protecting Brain Cells From Alzheimer's

New research shows that cannabis compounds protect neurons from the damaging effects of amyloid beta.

item.title: Timeline For Texas' Cannabis Oil Law Leads To Medical Refugees | Houston Public Media
item.description:
Timeline For Texas' Cannabis Oil Law Leads To Medical Refugees | Houston Public Media

The Department of Public Safety is meeting Thursday to go over the latest set of rules connected with Texas' limited medical marijuana law. LISTEN: Timeline For Texas' Cannabis Oil Law Leads To Medical Refugees The Department of Public Safety is meeting Thursday to go over the latest set of rules connected with Texas' limited medical marijuana law.

item.title: After DEA Punts on Pot, Sen. Menéndez Says He'll Push For Comprehensive Medical Marijuana Law in Texas
item.description:
After DEA Punts on Pot, Sen. Menéndez Says He'll Push For Comprehensive Medical Marijuana Law in Texas

click to enlarge The Drug Enforcement Agency on Thursday announced it was still way behind the times after refusing to reschedule marijuana out of its strictest drug control category, despite the growing consensus among experts that it doesn't belong there. Rhode Island Gov. Gina Raimondo, Washington Gov.

item.title: The DEA will still treat weed the same as heroin | VICE News
item.description:
The DEA will still treat weed the same as heroin | VICE News

Marijuana will remain illegal for any purpose under federal law in the United States, even though it's legal for medical and recreational use in several states with more potentially on the way. The Drug Enforcement Agency announced on Thursday that weed will continue to be classified as Schedule 1 under the Controlled Substances Act, alongside substances including heroin and GHB.

item.title: DEA Denies Cannabis Rescheduling, Expands Research Policies - Cannabis Business Times
item.description:
DEA Denies Cannabis Rescheduling, Expands Research Policies - Cannabis Business Times

The U.S. Drug Enforcement Agency denied two petitions to reschedule cannabis from Schedule I, according to an announcement released by the organization Aug. 11. This denial means maintaining the DEA's current stance that marijuana has no medical value. The DEA also increased the number of registered manufacturers supplying marijuana for research.

item.title: US to allow more marijuana research, sources say | Fox News
item.description:
US to allow more marijuana research, sources say | Fox News

The U.S. government will announce on Thursday that it will allow more research into marijuana but has rejected requests to relax the classification of the substance as a dangerous, highly addictive drug with no medical use, sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

item.title: Gallup: More than 33 million American adults currently use marijuana
item.description:
Gallup: More than 33 million American adults currently use marijuana

A new Gallup poll out today finds that percent of American adults who say they currently smoke marijuana has nearly doubled over the past three years. In 2013, only 7 percent of adults said they were marijuana smokers. When Gallup asked again in July of this year, 13 percent admitted to current marijuana use.
